intro: Tecoma chrysea, commonly known as the golden trumpetbush, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble trumpets. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a smooth texture. Tecoma chrysea thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
